titleStmt.title: John Welch et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5692

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

p.note: I. concur with Mr Reasor. Geo W. Johnston.

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner John Welch would respectfully state that he was tried at the may term of the Jefferson Circuit Court upon an Indictment for the murder of Allen Gavin. A verdict of guilty was rendered & he was sentenced to be hanged July 22d 1864.

The true facts of the killing are as follows, On the morning of the unfortunate killing Petitioner was at the house of deceased & was attacked by the husband of decd with an axe, & in shooting at the Husband unfortunately his wife was killed.

Your Excellency is respectfully refered to a certified copy of the evidence had on the trial & also a statement of the abandon character of the
witnesses for the Commonwealth, your petitioner is a private Soldier, in the 130th Reg Ind Vol, enlisted in Dec 1863.
Your petitioner never intended any harm to decd & now feels an unestemable sorrow that the sad accident caused the death of Mrs Gavin.
Your Petitioner prays your Excellency to grant him a pardon
We the undersigned citizens of Louisville Kentucky earnestly unite in the prayre of the Petitioner

W K Thomes
H.C. Thomas Deputy Jailor
Burton Forman Turn Key
J. S. Cave police
John Enlow Polceman
Wm McGuire Policeman
H C Russell Dep marsh
J C Baird policeman
W. B. Hardin. policeman,
Geo Seaton Dept Marshal
Joseph Swiney
J B Ehrich, Clerk of Police
W R Hyde city mar
John M. Trayler
Alexander Gilmore Police man
Thos. Foreman Police,
I M Shindler Police
W., H. Boyle Do
Ryan Do
Thos Jeffrey Night Police
Poliecman

Geo. Mullikin Assist Assessor
E. K. Seely Jail Physician

James C Gill, Coroner J. C. Ky

J. W Knight M.D.

C. W. Tiller Poleiceman

William N, Sinkhorn Policeman
Hervey Seaton Polieceman
M G Holmes Supt WrkHous
A. W. R. Harris City Assessor
K P. Thixton C. Tax, Col, W,D
Oliver Lucas Clerk Board Aldermen.
T. Jack Conn clk co.ct. Jeff cty
J M Vaughn clk Coun Council
Henry Wolford City Treasurer
Wm McCarrell City Auditor
A Y Johnson
James L. Turner Policeman
Amos Monroe Judge County Court
H. C. Griffy Policeman
Wm Owington Policeman
John. G. Antle Policeman
E, W Rutledge DS for W A Ronald
Joel Lambourne Policeman
understanding that a majority of the Jury which tried the case have joined in a petition for the pardon, I, therefore, unite in the prayer in like manner.

Respectfully,
Robt J. Elliott
ass't city attorney

I see that seven nine of the Jurymen that tried the petitioner have asked for him -- pardon, Nearly all of those, who have signed the petition, are well known and are well acquainted with the circumstances, attending the killing, of Mrs Gavin, and are well acquainted with the witnesses for the prosecution, on the trial, and their statements are entitled to full credit and influence

Respectfully
W G Reasor cty atto.
